data.title: 100 Movie Trivia Questions and Answers
data.meta_description: Check your knowledge on movies and challenge your friends and family with movie trivia questions. Find the questions and answers in this article.
data.text:
The world of movies is complex. Behind the scenes are the stories of the characters, the massive effort of the film crew, and the art of filmmaking. That is what makes movies so captivating to us. Just as interesting are the discussions and the games centered around our favorite movies, cinematic universes, and the industry overall.

In this article, we welcome you to explore the world of cinema through 100 trivia questions. Whether you are testing your knowledge or playing with your friends or family these questions will definitely challenge you.

The questions are distributed into different categories. The answers can be found under their respective questions.

Trivia Questions on Movies Based on Books

There is nothing better than watching your favorite book characters come to life in movies, starring your favorite actors and visualizing the fantasy world of literature. Check how well you know the joint world of cinema and literature with the help of these 20 questions.

1. Which of these movies is not based on a book?

Little Women

The Hunger Games

The Godfather

Avatar

Correct answer: D

2. Who directed the film adaptation of J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Lord of the Rings" trilogy?

Peter Jackson

Christopher Nolan

Steven Spielberg

George Lucas

Correct answer: A

3. In the "Harry Potter" film series, who played the character Hermione Granger?

Emma Watson

Emma Stone

Emma Roberts

Emma Thompson

Correct answer: A

4. Who wrote the novel "Jurassic Park," which was adapted into a blockbuster film directed by Steven Spielberg?

Stephen King

Michael Crichton

John Grisha

Dan Brown

Correct answer: B

5. The film "The Shawshank Redemption" is based on a novella by which author?

Stephen King

John Grisham

J.K. Rowling

Dan Brown

Correct answer: A

6. Which of Jane Austen's novels was adapted into the movie starring Keira Knightley?

Sense and Sensibility

Mansfield Park

Pride and Prejudice

Emma

Correct answer: C

7. Who wrote the novel "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo," which was later adapted into a film?

Suzanne Collins

Gillian Flynn

Paula Hawkins

Stieg Larsson

Correct answer: D

8. The film "The Godfather" is based on a novel of the same name written by whom?

Mario Puzo

John Grisham

Michael Connelly

Tom Clancy

Correct answer: A

9. Which Shakespeare play served as the basis for the modern film adaptation "10 Things I Hate About You"?

Romeo and Juliet

Macbeth

The Taming of the Shrew

Hamlet

Correct answer: C

10. Who directed the film adaptation of Michael Lewis's book "Moneyball"?

Steven Spielberg

David Fincher

Christopher Nolan

Bennett Miller

Correct answer: D

11. In the film adaptation of "The Hunger Games," who portrayed the protagonist, Katniss Everdeen?

Jennifer Lawrence

Emma Watson

Shailene Woodley

Kristen Stewart

Correct answer: A

12. The movie "The Martian" is based on a novel written by whom?

Isaac Asimov

Philip K. Dick

Andy Weir

Arthur C. Clarke

Correct answer: C

13. Who wrote the novel "The Silence of the Lambs," which was adapted into the famous film starring Anthony Hopkins?

Stephen King

Thomas Harris

John Grisham

Michael Crichton

Correct answer: B

14. The film "Gone Girl" is based on a psychological thriller novel written by which author?

Gillian Flynn

Paula Hawkins

Liane Moriarty

Jodi Picoult

Correct answer: A

15. The movie "The Shining" is based on a novel written by which acclaimed horror author?

Clive Barker

H.P. Lovecraft

Edgar Allan Poe

Stephen King

Correct answer: D

16. Who directed the film adaptation of the novel "The Fault in Our Stars" by John Green?

Richard Linklater

Wes Anderson

Josh Boone

Greta Gerwig

Correct answer: C

17. The film "The Revenant," starring Leonardo DiCaprio, is based on a novel written by whom?

Cormac McCarthy

Michael Punke

Jhumpa Lahiri

Don DeLillo

Correct answer: B

18. In the film "The Green Mile," based on a novel by Stephen King, who played the role of John Coffey?

Tom Hanks

Morgan Freeman

Michael Clark Duncan

Denzel Washington

Correct answer: C

19. "The Curious Case of Benjamin Button" is based on a short story written by which author?

Edward Allan Poe

Ernest Hemingway

Herman Hesse

F. Scott Fitzgerald

Correct answer: D

20. Which of these movies is based on a book?

La La Land

The Lovely Bones

The Hunt

Inception

Correct answer: B

Christmas Movie Trivia Questions

Many believe that Christmas is the most wonderful time of the year - cue Andy Williams! The presents, the Christmas tree and the magical atmosphere fill our hearts with warmth and joy. Christmas movies are a significant part of the magical holiday season. These questions will check your knowledge of crowd-favorite classic Christmas movies.

1. In the movie "Home Alone," what is the name of the young boy who is accidentally left behind when his family goes on vacation for Christmas?

Kevin

Charlie

Max

Buddy

Correct answer: A

2. In which Christmas movie George Bailey learns the importance of his own life with the help of an angel?

A Christmas Carol

Miracle on 34th Street

It's a Wonderful Life

White Christmas

Correct answer: C

3. In the movie "Elf," what food does the main character Buddy like?

Candy

Pasta

Syrup

Vegetables

Correct answer: B

4. Who narrates the animated classic "How the Grinch Stole Christmas!"?

Jim Carrey

Will Ferrell

Tom Hanks

Boris Karloff

Correct answer: D

5. In the movie "The Polar Express," what is the destination of the train on Christmas Eve?

The North Pole

Santa's Workshop

Candy Cane Lane

Winter Wonderland

Correct answer: A

6. What 2003 Christmas movie stars Will Ferrell as a human raised by elves at the North Pole?

The Santa Clause

Jingle All the Way

Elf

The Grinch

Correct answer: C

7. In "A Charlie Brown Christmas," what kind of tree does Charlie choose?

A fake tree

A real tree

A giant tree

A Christmas bush

Correct answer: B

8. Which 1989 film features a dysfunctional family trying to have a "good old-fashioned family Christmas"?

National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation

A Christmas Story

Scrooged

Home Alone 2: Lost in New York

Correct answer: A

9. In the movie "The Nightmare Before Christmas," what is the name of the main character who wants to take over Christmas?

Oogie Boogie

Sally

Jack Skellington

Zero

Correct answer: C

10. Which Christmas movie centers around a young boy who befriends a train conductor and takes a magical train ride to the North Pole?

The Santa Clause

Miracle on 34th Street

Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer

The Polar Express

Correct answer: D

11. In the film "A Christmas Carol," who is the miserly main character visited by three ghosts on Christmas Eve?

Ebenezer Scrooge

Bob Cratchit

Jacob Marley

Tiny Tim

Correct answer: A

12. Which 1990 movie features Macaulay Culkin defending his home from burglars during Christmas?

The Grinch

Home Alone

A Christmas Story

The Santa Clause

Correct answer: B

13. What is the main character's name in the 2004 film "The Polar Express"?

Billy Little

Chris Slow

Tom Tiny

Hero Boy

Correct answer: D

14. Which 1983 film tells the story of a young boy named Ralphie and his quest for a Red Ryder BB gun for Christmas?

Elf

A Christmas Story

Home Alone

The Santa Clause

Correct answer: B

15. In the movie "Love Actually," which famous actor plays the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom who falls in love with his assistant?

Colin Firth

Hugh Grant

Liam Neeson

Alan Rickman

Correct answer: B

16. Which 2006 film follows the lives of multiple characters in London during the Christmas season and intertwines their stories?

The Holiday

Love Actually

Four Christmases

The Family Stone

Correct answer: A

17. What is the name of the young boy who befriends a snowman that comes to life in the animated short film "The Snowman"?

Billy

Tommy

James

Michael

Correct answer: C

18. In the 1992 film "Home Alone 2: Lost in New York," where does Kevin accidentally end up during Christmas?

Chicago

Miami

Los Angeles

New York City

Correct answer: D

19. In the movie "The Santa Clause," who accidentally causes Santa Claus to fall off the roof and then must take on the role of Santa?

Scott Calvin

Charlie Calvin

Bernard

Mrs. Claus

Correct answer: A

20. What were the names of the two main villains in the movie Home Alone?

John and Brad

Peter and Stanley

Allan and Rick

Harry and Marvin

Correct answer: D

Science-Fiction Movie Trivia Questions

Science-Fiction is one of the most popular movie genres across the globe. The first ever science-fiction movie, "A Trip to the Moon," came out over a century ago. Science-fiction challenges our imagination and makes us think about concepts that lie beyond the horizon of current knowledge. Here are 20 questions on iconic science-fiction movies.

1. In the movie "Blade Runner," what is the term used for bioengineered beings that are virtually identical to humans?

robots

terminators

replicants

artificial intelligence

Correct answer: C

2. Which 1999 sci-fi film directed by the Wachowskis explores the concept of simulated reality and features the iconic bullet-dodging scene?

The Matrix

Star Trek Two

Resident Evil

Vanilla Sky

Correct answer: A

3. What is the name of the spaceship in the movie "2001: A Space Odyssey"?

Space Explorer 23

Discovery One

Apollo Eight

Voyager

Correct answer: B

4. In "The Matrix," what color pill does Neo take to learn the truth about the simulated reality?

purple

orange

blue

red

Correct answer: D

5. Which 1982 sci-fi film directed by Steven Spielberg features a young boy befriending an alien stranded on Earth?

Alien

Species

E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial

Paul

Correct answer: C

6. Who directed the 2014 science fiction film "Interstellar"?

Christopher Nolan

Steven Spielberg

Quentin Tarantino

Alfred Hitchcock

Correct answer: A

7. In the "Star Wars" universe, what is the name of Han Solo's ship?

The Era Eagle

The Epoch Hawk

The Time Phoenix

The Millenium Falcon

Correct answer: D

8. What is the substance that allows for interstellar travel in the film "Dune"?

mirage

mélange

meringue

methigel

Correct answer: B

9. Which actor played the lead role in the 2015 film "The Martian," directed by Ridley Scott?

Matt LeBlanc

Matt Bomer

Matt Damon

Matt Dillon

Correct answer: C

10. In "Inception," what is the name of the device used to enter and manipulate dreams?

PASIV

PASON

PASIN

PASOF

Correct answer: A

11. Which 1984 sci-fi film, directed by James Cameron, features a cyborg assassin sent back in time to kill the mother of the future leader of the human resistance?

Dune

Runaway

Starman

The Terminator

Correct answer: D

12. Who played the role of Ellen Ripley in the "Alien" film series?

Susan Sarandon

Veronica Cartwright

Sigourney Weaver

Zoe Saldana

Correct answer: C

13. In "Ender's Game," what is the name of the young protagonist who is recruited by the military to lead Earth's forces against an alien race?

Michael

Andrew

Ben

Harry

Correct answer: B

14. Which 2016 sci-fi film, directed by Denis Villeneuve, centers around a linguist tasked with communicating with extraterrestrial beings?

Maelstrom

Enemy

Dune

Arrival

Correct answer: D

15. What is the title of the 1979 Ridley Scott film that introduced the iconic extraterrestrial creature known as the Xenomorph?

Alien

Prometheus

The Thing

E.T. - The Extra-Terrestrial

Correct answer: A

16. In "The Fifth Element," who plays the character Korben Dallas, a former special forces major?

Jason Statham

Sylvester Stallone

Vin Diesel

Bruce Willis

Correct answer: D

17. Which 2013 film, directed by Alfonso Cuarón, follows two astronauts stranded in space after their shuttle is destroyed?

Astronomical

Gravity

Black Hole

Orbit

Correct answer: B

18. What is the name of the artificial intelligence system in the "Terminator" series that becomes self-aware and launches a nuclear apocalypse?

SkyNet

AirWeb

AtmoTrap

VaultBag

Correct answer: A

19. In the movie "Minority Report," who plays the character John Anderton, a PreCrime officer who becomes a fugitive?

Tom Hiddleston

Tom Hanks

Tom Cruise

Tom Hardy

Correct answer: B

20. In the "Star Wars" saga, what is the name of the desert planet where Anakin Skywalker and Luke Skywalker were raised?

Dimidium

Halla

Bambaruush

Tatooine

Correct answer: D

Trivia Questions on the Golden Age of Hollywood

The Golden Age of Hollywood is the foundation of the film industry that we know today. It lasted roughly from the 1920s to the 1960s. During this period, the five major production studios created a list of iconic movies, which have now become classics. It was during this period that the filmmaking industry went to groundbreaking changes such as the use of sound and color. Here are 20 questions that will check your knowledge of this iconic era of film.

1. Who was known as the "King of Hollywood" during the Golden Age?

Cary Grant

Clark Gable

Humphrey Bogart

Henry Fonda

Correct answer: B

2. Which legendary actress starred in "Gone with the Wind" and won an Oscar for her role?

Olivia de Havilland

Hattie McDaniel

Alicia Rhett

Vivien Leigh

Correct answer: D

3. Which iconic film director was responsible for classics like "Citizen Kane" and "The Third Man"?

Orson Welles

Alfred Hitchcock

John Ford

John Huston

Correct answer: A

4. What was the first feature-length animated film released by Disney during the Golden Age?

Peter Pan

Dumbo

Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

Cinderella

Correct answer: C

5. Who played the role of Rick Blaine in "Casablanca," one of the most celebrated films of the era?

Paul Henreid

Humphrey Bogart

Peter Lorre

Claude Rains

Correct answer: B

6. Which musical duo starred in a series of popular films during the Golden Age, including "Top Hat" and "Swing Time"?

Judy Garland and Mickey Rooney

Gene Kelly and Debbie Reynolds

Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers

Betty Grable and Dan Dailey

Correct answer: C

7. Which film won the first Academy Award for Best Picture in 1929?

Wings

The Racket

7th Heaven

The Parade

Correct answer: A

8. Which actress became the first African American to win an Academy Award for Best Actress during the Golden Age?

Nina Mae McKinney

Ethel Waters

Dorothy Dandridge

Hattie McDaniel

Correct answer: D

9. Which legendary comedian and actor was known for his slapstick comedy and iconic mustache during this era?

Oliver Hardy

Groucho Marx

Charlie Chaplin

Bud Abbott

Correct answer: C

10. Who directed the classic film "It's a Wonderful Life" starring James Stewart?

Frank Sinatra

Frank Capra

Frank Lloyd Wright

Frank Costello

Correct answer: B

11. What was the title of the first "talkie" or synchronized sound film, marking a major milestone in the industry?

The Jazz Singer

Wings

The Golden Rush

City Lights

Correct answer: A

12. Which actor starred in films like "A Streetcar Named Desire" and "On the Waterfront" during the Golden Age?

Richard Garrick

Nick Dennis

Wright King

Marlon Brando

Correct answer: D

13. In the 1939 film "The Wizard of Oz," what is the name of Dorothy's dog?

Mimi

Toto

Roro

Lola

Correct answer: B

14. What 1946 film, directed by Frank Capra, tells the story of a man who is shown what life would have been like if he had never existed?

It Happened One Night

Meet John Doe

It's a Wonderful Life

Lost Horizon

Correct answer: C

15. What actor starred in the film "All About Eve" and won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor?

George Sanders

Gary Merrill

Walter Hampden

Gregory Ratoff

Correct answer: A

16. Who directed the film "The Maltese Falcon," a classic example of film noir from the Golden Age?

Orson Welles

Alfred Hitchcock

John Ford

John Huston

Correct answer: D

17. Who was the first Hollywood actress to hold the unofficial title of "America's Sweetheart," known for her roles in silent films and her contributions to the founding of United Artists studio.

Dorothy Gish

Mary Pickford

Katherine Hepburn

Joan Crawford

Correct answer: B

18. During the Hollywood Golden Age, what was the name of the famous studio known for its glamorous musicals, including "Singin' in the Rain" and "An American in Paris"?

Warner Brothers

Paramount

20th Century Fox

Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

Correct answer: D

19. Which director, often referred to as the "Master of Suspense," directed several classic films during the Golden Age, such as "Psycho," "Rear Window," and "Vertigo"?

Orson Welles

Alfred Hitchcock

John Ford

John Huston

Correct answer: B

20. Who was a part of the "Hollywood Ten," a group of 10 film industry members who refused to testify to an anti-communist committee hearing during the Second Red Scare era.

Adrian Scott

Ethan Anderson

Lucas Bennett

Miles Parker

Correct answer: D

Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) Trivia Questions

As years go by the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) expands its audience due to the captivating storylines of its characters. Get ready to prove your expertise and challenge your understanding of iconic MCU superheroes and storylines by answering these 20 questions.

1. Who is the primary antagonist in the first Avengers movie (2012)?

Thanos

Scarlet Witch

Black Widow

Loki

Correct answer: D

2. In "Guardians of the Galaxy," what is the name of the criminal organization led by the main antagonist, Ronan the Accuser?

Kree Accuser Corps

Zarek Accuser Corps

Starforce Corps

Inhuman Corps

Correct answer: A

3. Which Infinity Stone is embedded in Vision's forehead?

Space Stone

Soul Stone

Mind Stone

Time Stone

Correct answer: C

4. What is the real name of the hero known as Black Widow?

Natasha Romanoff

Ekaterina Ivanoff

Anastasia Petroff

Olga Sokoloff

Correct answer: A

5. In "Thor: Ragnarok," what is the name of the planet where Thor becomes a gladiator?

Asgard

Sakaar

Morag

Xandar

Correct answer: B

6. Which actor plays the character Tony Stark/Iron Man in the MCU?

Tom Hiddleston

Chris Hemsworth

Sebastian Stan

Robert Downey Jr.

Correct answer: D

7. What is the name of Doctor Strange's mentor and predecessor?

The Wise One

The Olden One

The Ancient One

The Eldest One

Correct answer: C

8. In "Black Panther," what is the name of the fictional African country that T'Challa rules over?

Wakanda

Zamunda

Sokovia

Genovia

Correct answer: A

9. Which Avengers movie features the Battle of Wakanda?

The Avengers

The Avengers: Age of Ultron

Avengers: Infinity War

Avengers: Endgame

Correct answer: C

10. What is the name of the computer system created by Tony Stark that becomes self-aware and poses a threat to humanity in "Avengers: Age of Ultron"?

Jarvis

Homer

Scepter

Ultron

Correct answer: D

11. Which character sacrifices himself to save New York City in "The Avengers" by carrying a nuclear missile through a wormhole?

Iron Man

Captain America

Captain Marvel

Hulk

Correct answer: A

12. In "Ant-Man," what is the name of the technology that allows Scott Lang to shrink and grow in size?

Pi Particle

Pym Particle

Sigma Particle

Prism Particle

Correct answer: B

13. What is the name of the powerful alien race that attacks Earth in the first Avengers movie?

Kree

Cotati

Chitauri

Badoon

Correct answer: C

14. Who is the director of "Guardians of the Galaxy" and its sequel?

Peter Safran

Joe Russo

Taika Waititi

James Gunn

Correct answer: D

15. What is the name of Thor's enchanted hammer?

Valkyrie

Mjolnir

Valhalla

Ragnarok

Correct answer: B

16. Who is the main antagonist in "Spider-Man: Homecoming"?

Adrien Toomes

Otto Octavius

Max Dillon

Curtis Connors

Correct answer: A

17. What is the title of the first MCU film ever released in 2008?

The Avengers

Thor

Iron Man

Captain America

Correct answer: C

18. What is the name of the character played by Benedict Cumberbatch in the Marvel Cinematic Universe?

Ant-Man

Drax

Doctor Octopus

Doctor Strange

Correct answer: D

19. WhIn "Avengers: Infinity War," which character successfully wields Stormbreaker, Thor's new weapon forged in Nidavellir?

Spider-Man

Captain America

Hulk

Thanos

Correct answer: B

20. Which actor plays the role of Sam Wilson?

Will Smith

Anthony Mackie

Samuel L. Jackson

Jamie Foxx

Correct answer: B

Wrapping Up!

We hope you aced all the questions, and if not, hope you gained new knowledge on the captivating world of cinema.

If you want to take your fun trivia night to the next level, you can use the free Quiz Maker WordPress plugin to turn your quiz into an online game that you can play with your friends and family.
